oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage showing a family reunion, a dancer, a memorial, and five ads. Nashville Banner, 1928 September 30.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Arnold, B. K.; Arnold, Will; Arnold, Charles; Davis, Mrs. Thomas J.; Arnold, Basie; Arnold, Pet; Arnold, Moody; Donnath, Gertrude; Winkler, Margaret Ward; Maury, Matthew Fontaine; Savage, Henry Hickson
Nashville Banner
Reunions; Group portraits; Dancers; Monuments & memorials; Children
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage showing a family reunion (from Shelbyville), a dancer from Nashville, a memorial to a Naval officer who lived for a time in Williamson County, and five ads, one of which features a child who resides at 201 Manchester Avenue. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: P. & A. Photo; Calvert
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
